item.title: For sale sign on public lamppost plus bar code below it, 31st May
item.description:
On the corner of Newcourt Pk there is a For Sale sign attached with plastic ties to the lamppost, together with a separate bar code below it. For Sale signs are not allowed to be placed on public property, only the property owner's own property.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Newcourt Park, Cheltenham

item.title: Trees on corner of Longway Avenue/parkwood Grove too big and damaging footpath, 30th May
item.description:
2 trees, maple I believe, on the corner of Longway Avenue to Parkwood Grove are very large and tall and are beginning to damage the public footpath. They are also continuing to block the sunlight to our garden and growing over our garden. Please can someone inspect the trees and cut them down and back.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Longway Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree overhanging private gardens and blocking access to public footpath, 30th May
item.description:
I am writing to formally bring to your attention an issue concerning a tree located on the verge outside 211 & 213 Hewlett road Cheltenham. The tree in question is overhanging private gardens but extends significantly into the public footpath, causing a serious obstruction for pedestrians. This overgrowth not only impedes safe passage but also poses a potential hazard, especially for individuals with mobility difficulties, parents with strollers, and cyclists. The tree in question is owned and maintained by the council. Its overhanging branches are encroaching into our private gardens and obstructing the public footpath, creating a hazard for pedestrians and impeding access. According to local regulations and the council's responsibilities under the Highways Act 1980 (or relevant local legislation), the council has a duty to maintain trees on public land to prevent such obstructions. I kindly request that the council take immediate action to trim the overhanging branches and ensure the safety and accessibility of the footpath and gardens. Kind regards Caroline Armer Fisher
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 205, Hewlett Road, Battledown, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: SUGGESTION : Could you add a '50mph' repeater sign near the airfield ?, 30th May
item.description:
SUGGESTION : Could you add a '50mph' repeater sign near the airfield please ? You were kind enough to add a 50 repeater on the north bound staverton lane recently (north of the traffic lights), but there is no corresponding repeater sign on the southbound side, until you get to or just past the M5 bridge. Would it be possible to add one in where feasible and appropriate please ? Thanks again for the other extra sign on the north of the traffic lights !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bamfurlong Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign plate is missing (Non illuminating sign)

item.description:
Tree is by my house GL54 5AG called Dryfield Meadow Barn. Think it was struck by lightning or bad storm as it’s split in half. Looks very dangerous and other half could fall. Have checked boundary and it is on highway side.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury

item.category: Tree causing damage/obstruction to pavement or road

item.title: Fly tipping, 30th May
item.description:
Guess what?? More rubbish has been dumped here last night. The sofa and chair that were there for a week have now gone. But within 24 hours more rubbish arrives. Happens nearly every week and has done for years. Why do you do nothing to prevent it happening or to fine the people responsible?? It makes a fairly tatty part of town look like a rubbish dump.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Pates Avenue, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction of Clarade Street and St Georges Place, 30th May
item.description:
The junction here was recently relined, but the condition of the road surface wasn't addressed. The uneven surface is a danger to all road users especially cyclists. Indeed the condition of the road surface along many stretches of Clarence Street is wholly inadequate and extremely undulating for all vehicle users. More needs to be done and if only each relevant department could communicate with one other it may help improve the condition of our roads and safety of those who use it. STOP WASTING MINE AND OTHERS COUNCIL TAX MONEY PLEASE 🙏

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61;61a, Clarence Street, St Paul’s, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown tree - sticky sap, debris and scratches car, 30th May
item.description:
Tree that has significantly overgrown above designated parking space number 34 on Brockweir Rd, Cheltenham GL52 5FP. Large tree regularly drops sticky sap and debris onto vehicles, which not only obscures the windows by creating a solid sticky residue - creating a potential safety hazard, a slippery surface around vehicles when wet - but also damages the paintwork. In addition to the sap, overhanging branches have begun scratching car doors, to the extent that it is now required to park partially on the road to try to avoid further damage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32;36;38;40;42;44;46;48, Brockweir Road, Oakley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
